intro: Carica monoica, commonly known as the papaya tree, is a tropical plant native to Central America and the Caribbean. It is a member of the Caricaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and yellow-orange fruits. The plant is monoecious, meaning it has both male and female flowers on the same individual. Its fruit is rich in vitamins and enzymes, particularly papain, which is used in cooking and medicine. The tree typically grows to a height of 3–10 meters and thrives in warm, humid climates.
